chapters.title: The Whisper from the Stacks
chapters.summary: Elara Vance, a terminally ill archivist, receives a mysterious, ancient book that seems to call to her from the depths of her own library's restricted section.
key_events: Elara receives a grim prognosis, with only months to live.
While working late, she finds a pulsating, leather-bound book she's never catalogued.
The book opens on its own, revealing shifting, alien script.
A portal of light and sound erupts from its pages, pulling her in.
chapters.ending_hook: Elara collapses onto foreign soil, under a bruised purple sky, as three towering, fading figures look down at her with desperate, star-filled eyes.

chapters.title: A World Unwritten
chapters.summary: Elara meets the dying gods of Aethel and learns the true, devastating reason for her summoning.
key_events: The gods—Kael (Memory), Lyra (Song), and Orin (Stone)—introduce themselves.
They explain their world is in its final, unstoppable death throes, its magic bleeding away.
A prophecy spoke of a 'Last Witness' from beyond the stars, not a warrior.
They ask her not to fight, but to remember and preserve their stories before the end.
chapters.ending_hook: They offer her a choice: return home to die, or stay and become their archivist. From a hilltop, Elara sees the first city begin to crumble into silent dust.

chapters.title: The First Story: The Weeping Citadel
chapters.summary: Elara begins her work, recording the history of a crumbling city, and meets a resistance fighter who challenges her passive role.
key_events: Elara is guided to the Weeping Citadel, a library-city of crystal.
She uses a magical quill to transcribe histories directly from the fading walls.
She meets Tarn, a scarred soldier leading a desperate defense against 'The Unmaking'.
Tarn scorns her as a 'ghoul' collecting epitaphs while his people die.
chapters.ending_hook: As Elara records the Citadel's final song, Tarn's squad is overrun. He screams at her to remember *this* too, as the crystal library shatters around them.

chapters.title: The Weight of Ink and Memory
chapters.summary: Elara's health and resolve are tested as the act of preservation becomes physically and emotionally draining.
key_events: Elara discovers her transcription magic accelerates her own illness, trading her life for memory.
She records the story of the River of Names, which is evaporating.
A god, Orin, begins to dissolve, entrusting her with his core myth.
She experiences a memory-storm, living through the trauma of those she records.
chapters.ending_hook: Exhausted and coughing blood onto her pages, Elara finds a sketch of Earth in the archives—proof her own world was once connected and has already forgotten Aethel.

chapters.title: The Archive of Falling Stars
chapters.summary: Elara and a reluctant Tarn journey to a flying archive, seeking a legendary master-catalogue of the world.
key_events: Tarn agrees to guide her, hoping the archive holds a weapon, not just stories.
They navigate a landscape being erased by a silent, grey wave (The Unmaking).
They find the archive, held aloft by the last dying star-whale.
The keeper is a golem who only speaks in archived poetry.
chapters.ending_hook: The master-catalogue is not a book, but a seed. The star-whale dies, and the archive begins to fall from the sky.

chapters.title: The Rebellion of the Remembered
chapters.summary: Tarn's resistance, inspired by the stories Elara has saved, makes a final stand, forcing her to witness their end.
key_events: Tarn uses Elara's recorded war-songs to rally the last defenders.
Elara is brought to the battlefield to 'do her job'.
She transcribes not just events, but the final thoughts and loves of falling soldiers.
The god Lyra sings a dirge that momentarily holds back The Unmaking.
chapters.ending_hook: Tarn falls, but not before pressing his own story-locket into Elara's hand. Lyra's song ends, and her form shatters into silent notes.

chapters.title: The God Who Would Be Forgotten
chapters.summary: The last god, Kael, reveals a painful truth: for the memories to be truly saved, the rememberer must also be forgotten.
key_events: Kael is now barely more than a whisper.
He explains the seed from the archive must be planted in a world that never knew Aethel, where it will grow into a new memory-tree.
But the plan requires Elara to be severed from both worlds—her existence in Aethel erased, and any memory of her on Earth to remain gone.
He offers her a final mercy: a quick death now, instead of this double oblivion.
chapters.ending_hook: Elara, holding Tarn's locket, refuses the mercy. She agrees to become the forgotten vessel.

chapters.title: The Unraveling
chapters.summary: Elara performs the final, world-spanning act of remembrance as The Unmaking consumes everything.
key_events: Elara travels to the last sacred sites, the quill burning in her hand.
She absorbs the core stories of the elements, the beasts, the kings, and the common folk.
Kael speaks the last history—his own—and ceases to be.
The physical world dissolves into grey static around her.
chapters.ending_hook: Alone in a void, Elara holds the glowing seed, now saturated with all of Aethel. The only sound left is her own heartbeat, slowing.

chapters.title: The Planting
chapters.summary: Elara is returned to a point just before her diagnosis on Earth, to complete the final step.
key_events: She wakes at her desk in the library, the terminal diagnosis still in the future.
The seed is now a simple, polished stone in her hand.
She is a ghost in her own life; no one remembers her illness or her absence.
Following an instinct, she buries the seed-stone in the soil of the library's forgotten courtyard garden.
chapters.ending_hook: As the soil covers the seed, a sharp, final pain grips her chest. She knows her own story—her life on Earth—is now the price.

chapters.title: The Silent Spring
chapters.summary: Elara lives her final days as a stranger to herself, watching something impossible grow.
key_events: A strange, silver-barked sapling sprouts overnight in the courtyard.
Its leaves rustle with faint, unfamiliar melodies; its bark bears faint, unreadable carvings.
Elara feels weaker but drawn to the tree, sitting beneath it daily.
She begins writing her own, final memoir, though the words about Aethel blur on the page.
chapters.ending_hook: On her last day, she finishes her memoir. The final sentence reads only: 'I remember.' As she closes the book, the sentence fades, and she forgets why she was crying.

chapters.title: The Last Leaf
chapters.summary: Elara's passing and the transformation of the memory-tree.
key_events: Elara dies peacefully under the tree's branches.
Her memoir, now filled with blank pages, is found beside her.
The tree blossoms instantly with luminous, story-filled flowers.
A wind scatters the petals and leaves across the city and beyond.
chapters.ending_hook: Where each petal lands, a person—a child, a baker, a bus driver—is struck by a fleeting, beautiful dream of a world that never was, and feels a profound, inexplicable sense of loss and wonder.

chapters.title: Epilogue: The Library Without a Librarian
chapters.summary: Centuries later, the tree is a global wonder, and its influence is felt.
key_events: The 'Myth-Tree' is a protected world treasure, its wood unbreakable, its leaves eternally whispering.
Scholars study the untranslatable stories that play in the minds of those who touch it.
A new head archivist gives a tour, stating all myths are essential, as they are the memories we choose to hold.
A single, persistent story-fragment recurs to all who listen: a woman with a quill, and a soldier's locket.
chapters.ending_hook: A young, terminally ill visitor rests against the trunk. She closes her eyes and, for a moment, doesn't feel afraid. She feels like a witness.
